Datasheet for the CORE Soft IP Embedded Logic

Register Definitions

core This block is the core registers
Register Name Word Addr Offset Field Bits Type Reset Description
CSR_CORE_CONTROL 0x0 4 Core control register
CLR_HALT 0 w0 0 Clear test halt status
HALT_ON_ADDR 1 w 0 Enable/disable halt on specific address
HALT_ON_UNIMP 2 w 0 Halt on unimplemented instruction
HALT_ON_ECALL 3 w 0 Halt on ecall instruction
CSR_CORE_STATUS 0x1 2 Status of core
HALTED 0 r 0 Halted status
RESET 1 r 0 Reset status
CSR_CORE_HALT_ADDR 0x2 32 w 0x00000030 Halt address, if halt_on_addr active
CSR_CORE_GP 0x3 32 r 0 gp register value

Register/field type key:

TypeDescription
cConstant, with value defined by "reset" attribute
rsvSame as constant, except no reset value and always 0. Can be mixed with write types.
wWrite register (and read—no write only type). Register defined in register block and reset to "reset" attribute value. Split into fields (if applicable) for signalling and output, where attribute associated with fields, not register.
wpWrite with pulse. Register is not declared in block, but write bus split into fields as output port signals, and a pulse generated on write to register address. Register reads back values on matching data input ports. The "reset" attribute is for documentation only, as set externally.
w0Same as w, but auto-clears to 0 (and thus always reads as 0). At output port, signal will go high for one cycle when bit is written with a 1 (no effect if written to a 0). No "reset" attribute, as must always be 0.
rRead only value. Input ports generated for each field (where applicable), and concatenated on returned read data bus.
rpSimilar to r, but a pulse generated on a read access to the register address to allow peripheral logic to update value. The "reset" attribute is for documentation only, as set externally.
rwpSimilar to wp, but also generates a (separate) pulse on a read access to the register
